website_summaries.verdict: Huge storage capabilities and waterproof material make this a convenient option.
pros: We love how the waterproof material really stands up to rain
Adjustable straps with buckles make it easy to install
Universally compatible with all roof racks
cons: Some users tell us that using a pad under the bag can be helpful to avoid rubbing the top of the car

customer_reviews.title: picture does not tell the story
customer_reviews.text: I have learned a lot about cargo bags since about a week ago. I own an off road Xterra with a roof rack. the bag was too long to fit between rack rails. If u look at most of the pics of the various bags they all appeared stuffed full and easy to install with the attached straps. Mine was about 3/4 full for a trip to dallas. A lot of loose material had to be dealt with. I had used three rachet straps and tied down the attached bag straps and it was a complete hassle. I am glad I didn't spend more than 30.00.
customer_reviews.author: Valhalla

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the 1st time today traveling from NYC to Charlotte. Absolute garbage. Checked it for the 1st time in Maryland only about 200 miles or so and already had some ripping happening. Finally getting to Charlotte and checking it at the hotel, it is worse, not totally shredded but enough that some water from downpours leaked in. Thankfully i put all 4 suitcases in heavy black bags. Still need to finish my drive tomorrow to Florida and than home again. Will be ordering a new different bag to arrive in Florida for the drive home.
customer_reviews.author: Steve klein

customer_reviews.title: It held the stuff well and had great tie-downs.
customer_reviews.text: It leaks. Traveled from Pennsylvania to Florida & back. On the way down, a toad choking rain storm through Virginia. We only packed things not damaged by water. Figured the leak was where the zippers met. Fixed that area with tape. On way back, rained hard from middle of North Carolina to southern Pennsylvania. The insides were soaked again. It held the stuff well and had great tie-downs.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Keeper 07203-1 Waterproof Roof Top Cargo Bag...
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold up long, and definitely isn't waterproof! Water resistant but not waterproof especially when driving during a downpour. After one season, the outside started cracking. I used it on two long trips and after one year it is now in the garbage. Get a good hard side and be done with the frustration. Plus it has marred the finish on the vehicle's top and the clear coat is damaged beyond simple waxing or buffing to repair the damage to the roof area. The straps became frayed by the wind and were useless after one 800 mile trip both ways. Do not waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Xpert1

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for a 5000 mile road trip. Works ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 5000 mile road trip. Works as advertised considering I drove through a tornado and it stayed strapped to the car with only a very small amount of water getting inside the bag. Need I say more? It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pack it as full as you can
customer_reviews.text: It served its purpose. We got it for my wife’s trip across country and for all the extra stuff for beach trips. If you do not pack it to capacity you will probably find some tears and it’s a little noisy. The wind from driving caused a few seams to open up in the spots that were loose. The straps could be a little easier to tighten and loosen but not a deal breaker. Overall it is what I expected but wish the seams could hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but not 100% waterproof
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay for this, it's a tough bag, and it holds a lot, but it's not completely waterproof. I drove 2000 miles with it, through three thunderstorms, and the contents did get damp -- not soaked, but definitely damp. So, if you're going to use it, I suggest you put items in it that you don't mind being exposed to some moisture, for example, sleeping bags in their own protective bags, sleeping mats (for camping), your tent, etc. Also, make sure the bag is zipped shut and the protective flap covers the zipper. Like securing your saddle before you giddy up, strap this sucker down tight atop your car before you drive off on your next adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Gesteland

customer_reviews.title: Lots of rain
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to travel from Houston, Tx to Orlando, Fl. Our car didn't have enough room for 3 suitcases. There were many rainstorms that we drove through that seemed like a hurricane was coming through. It even started flooding in one city. By the time we got to Florida and took our suitcases down from the top of the car, all of our clothes were damp. So as for waterproof, I'm not so sure. Now, for size, we fit one large suitcase and 2 regular rolling suitcases. We probably could have fit more. It's very roomy.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Berrospe

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The carrier was installed according to the written directions. An hour outside of our destination it sounded like a rock crashed into the window, but it wasn’t a rock, it was the entire red patch containing two of the straps with the hard plastic slamming against the window. We had to pull over off of the interstate and shove everything in our already packed car(taking son back to Penn State from Virginia Beach). Fortunately, we were only an hour away. I did not want to take the risk of the entire carrier flying off and possibly injuring someone. What a scary experience.
customer_reviews.author: jeannine66

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bag
customer_reviews.text: My family drove from Fairbanks Alaska to San Antonio Texas this past November. This bag made it the entire way without a single fail. I saw reviews stating that the zippers would break off but never happened with me. We were not gentle with it at all and it proved very durable. It got drug, dropped, rain and snowed on. This is a great bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality roof storage
customer_reviews.text: This is a big bag. It held our two large suitcases and a pack 'n play and a back pack. Due to the material, you have to make sure you have everything situated the correct way to get a full zipper closure. Traveled from Austin, TX to SC and had no issues. There is a bit of wind noise that is generated, that's to be expected. Nothing that a radio station can drown out. I would definitely recommend this to any family that is traveling. I did purchase a roof rack to place on my crossbars in order to get a good seal going. The combination of the two was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!  Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This product was a lifesaver! My daughter and just graduated from the university and we needed to get all of her stuff from NC to Texas. There was no way all of her stuff was going to fit in her Subaru Crosstrek. We loaded this Keeper with SO MUCH STUFF! It seemed bottomless. It stormed 14/20 hour drive. Nothing got wet. Still has a lot of life left! Great purchase and with Prime we got it in the nick of time.
customer_reviews.author: C Conley (Ramirez)

customer_reviews.title: I thought for sure our luggage would look like it had been dropped in a lake by the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for a long road trip to Tennessee. It was 875 miles and about 12 hours. It rained literally every single mile of that trip. I didn't expect it to truly be waterproof in those kinds of conditions, I thought for sure our luggage would look like it had been dropped in a lake by the time we finally arrived. I was surprised and relieved to see that only a corner of one of the suitcases was damp. Everything else was completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S. cargo topper for vehicle  :[
customer_reviews.text: 0 stars if possible!!! This bag is NOT water proof, or water resistant for that matter. Our gear was soaked the morning after one night of light showers. Very disappointed, dissatisfied, and will be asking for a full refund once we are done with our trip. I DO NOT recommend this product or style of cargo topper for a vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mpls to Seattle and survived in winter
customer_reviews.text: This bag has exceeded my expectations. I filled this to the brim for when I moved from Minneapolis, Minnesota to Seattle, Washington. I drove through heavy rain, snow, and also high winds. I had this strapped onto some Thule bars on top of my '08 Civic. The default straps worked perfectly. Didn't need extra straps at all. I definitely recommend this if you're on a budget, but also need good protection for your belongings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah L.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fits a lot, almost completely waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: This was great to use! We went camping in the national parks. 10 days of driving- sun, snow and torrential rain! The set up was easy, the straps never got loose, it was durable and sustained no damage! We fit 3 huge duffels, 6 sleeping bags and a few odds and ends into it! It was great for weather almost the whole trip. We had a torrential story on our trip home and some water got under the bag/keeper so the one bag was wet when we got home. It was the only time anything got we. I think it did amazingly!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Not weatherproof.
customer_reviews.text: KEEPER CARGO BAG. Drove 1300 miles with the cargo bag in January, 400 of it in driving rain. The inside of bag was wet on arrival, ruining several items inside. On preparing for the return trip I wondered if I might not have made it tight enough on the first trip, so spent a lot of time tightening and double-checking it. The rain was much lighter on the way back - only 50 miles or so - but the inside of the bag was wet again, though not as much. NOT weatherproof. Don't put anything inside it that might be damaged by getting wet, or just don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Swayze

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I've made in a while!
customer_reviews.text: Looking for extra storage on your next road trip? Well this rooftop Keeper is what you need. Purchased this to go on a road trip because we needed extra storage. This worked out so well we really didn't have to put any main luggage in the car. This carrier held 5 people's luggage plus a large duffel bag. It rained (a lot) on our ride to the location and no water got in this bag. It was not difficult to strap to the roof our our small size SUV. It also did not shift around while driving. Best investment I've made in a while!
customer_reviews.author: N.B.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product!
customer_reviews.text: After checking the reviews, I purchased this cargo bag instead of a hard-shell carrier and it was perfect. I drove from NYC to the middle of PA through a horrible rainstorm and the contents stayed perfectly dry and undamaged. The roof rack on my then-new Subaru Forester didn't have crossbars yet so I attached all the straps onto the two rails and placed a piece of rubber underneath to try and prevent slippage. It did slide backwards a little (we monitored it through the sunroof!) but not enough to make me stop and fix it. Being able to pack the cargo bag away when not using it, as well as the price, make me recommend this product without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Tracie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the premium bag and we just drove from Arizona to Seattle,about 75mph the whole way, went through rain, heat, and snow without any problems! We bought shelf liner for underneath the bag and it kept it from sliding! Fit a ton of stuff and it was well worth it! The zipper is kinda finicky sometimes but other than that it was great! I don't have front and rear crossbars so we just used the straps on the side bars and it was great!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cargo bag for camping/trips!
customer_reviews.text: We took this bag with us up into the Adirondacks for a week of camping, and it did not disappoint! The bag is spacious, with easy to use clips (versus other bags we've used which only had straps). As well, we went through some light rain with no issues with the interior getting wet. I will update as we do future trips on the durability. However, I would recommend getting a pad underneath the bag to prevent scratching on your vehicle roof. Overall, a great bag; would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Durable- Water Resistant- Better than Expected- GO Premium
customer_reviews.text: Great product very durable, water resistance was fantastic. Drove this 1200 miles, it held up great. No rips no tears. About 600 miles of the trip were under torrential downpours. Everything in the bag was dry when I arrived home. The bag was on my vehicle overnight as well during rain, prior to leaving my location, still dry. Definitely held more than i thought it would. I expected to have the product fray or only be used for this trip. It looks brand new and am definitely satisfied with the product. I went with the premium version of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: ColonFamY&L

customer_reviews.title: Gave us much needed space for our road trip
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on two road trips so far and it was great (11 total road hours). We have 160lb dog that takes up the entire cargo area of our SUV and this cargo bag made all the difference in what we could pack. I didn’t go through heavy rain but did experience rain and items stayed dry. Overall very pleased and unlike my last cargo bag which frayed and tore after the same two trips this one is fully intact. I’ll update after next few road trips if I notice any wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Kaveman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase, couldnt be happier
customer_reviews.text: Great product, so happy with the purchase. It allowed us to take so much more on our trip and fit perfectly on my small SUV. We took a 16 hour roundtrip ride at high speeds and it held up great. Will use it again and again! Note: We used a roof rack to secure it and I drive a Nissan rogue SV sport. Cons: gets very hot in the heat so don't put anything in it that could be affected by high heat or very cold conditions . But it was water proof!
customer_reviews.author: sara3737

customer_reviews.title: Failed on the return trip
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a cargo bag for a one-way trip, this is for you! If you want it to come back with you, don't bother. Two of the clips broke when I reinstalled to head back home after a long drive. I had to tie them Boy Scout style, then they flapped and whistled for 1500 miles all the way home. Completely ruined the bag. PRO: good price, kept everything dry as promised. CON: the plastic pieces are low quality and will break when tying down the bag, especially after the first use. Way too much money for a single-use product.
customer_reviews.author: DOGS

customer_reviews.title: A great fit for the Subaru Crosstrek
customer_reviews.text: A great fit for the Subaru Crosstrek, you just need to place the crossbars at the furthest forward and back positions. I do wish it was taller to allow for more luggage, but we managed to squeeze a good amount in it. There was minimal wind noise and it sat very securely with no worries of losing our belongings.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No roof racks
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag to help move from NY to FL overall about 22 hours on the road. No issues what so ever. Since I drive a small car and don’t have roof racks we tied the straps to the handles just inside each door on the the ceiling and added the ratchet straps just to be safe, which I would have done anyways. But it worked perfectly for what I needed. No rips or broken straps. No problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and worked very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a round trip drive from Ohio to Denver, Colorado. We encountered a rain storm and high winds and the normal wind as you travel through Iowa, Indiana, Nebraska route on I 80. I do not have cross bars on my Sienna. I was very pleased that the bag did not slip and product inside did not get wet. Very happy with this product and cost was minimal compared to the hard tops. I just took the bag down after 2 weeks. No rips or tears(I hauled xpens,, dog crates, and a few other items in it) It folded up nicely for storage. Make sure you put the rubber pad under it that is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bag is great, but the straps suck!
customer_reviews.text: We took ours on a 1600 mile trip. As far as the bag itself is concerned, you'd be hard pressed to find something better. HOWEVER, I do have a beef with this thing. We had to stop several times to re-tighten the straps. I eventually grew tired of stopping every 20-30 miles, and I stopped and bought some straps at Harbor Freight to keep it secure. Even with the added HF straps, the straps that come on the Keeper kept coming loose, and I wound up cutting them off. They just weren't worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang Man

customer_reviews.title: Understand how this works and you will love it
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this on our trip. Initially the wind noise was horrible. Couldn’t hear anything but the loud noise. Stopped several times to try to figure it out with some improvement but still some noise. Once I arrived at my destination I was able to research this issue and found this bag had to be packed right and straps have to be very tight. Ride back home was much better. Couldn’t even tell it was on the roof. We did drive through a rain storm for several hours. Everything inside was safe and dry. Nice product once you understand it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Connell

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Just made the trip from Indiana to Houston, TX and this bag was AWESOME! I used it on my rooftop basket on my Ford Explorer. Held up great to 70+mph interstate speeds! Held up to the wind, the rain, the bugs! Easy to load, unload, tie down, setup, and store. Worth EVERY penny. I can’t recommend this roof top storage bag enough! If you want extra room inside your vehicle during a road trip or a move, I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nick K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for budget families.
customer_reviews.text: While I generally reserve 5 stars for above and beyond expectations, I can't imagine this being a better cargo bag for the price. Our family of five used this on a road trip over 600 miles packing and unpacking four times and never had a zipper failure, snag, or stress on the bag. The room was more than I had hoped for as well; more than I could use without a ladder. This was used with the horizontal cross bars only, so I opted to buy thecargo mat, though I understand it's the same material and cheaper to use drawer anti skid mats. Combined I didn't see the bag slide at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: does the job for cheap
customer_reviews.text: For the price it does the job great to get things between point A and point B. Was able to fit all my car camping gear for two in it (except the cooler). I did 16+ highway hours and 4+ hrs on bumpy forest service roads without it budging. Drove through a downpour and nothing got wet. That being said loading it up and tying the straps down was a big hassle. I dreaded loading it back up after setting up camp then unloading/loading again when we wanted to find a different camp site. I will probably invest in a (much more expensive) hard sided box.
customer_reviews.author: awantura

customer_reviews.title: Held up for 4,000 miles so far!
customer_reviews.text: This has held up very well. We have taken two trips with it so far, the first one was over 700 miles round trip and it did great. The second trip was over 3000 miles round trip. The only issue we had was we ran into a severe Texas thunderstorm on our second trip and the contents of our case did get damp. Not soaking wet. But a box we had was damp enough to fall apart. Our suitcases were damp outside but not wet enough to seap through to our clothes. Overall, I am very pleased. Just be aware that in extremely wet situations, there may be some dampness...
customer_reviews.author: vicki tapia

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase! We've used this bag on three 600+-mile ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good purchase! We've used this bag on three 600+-mile trips and had no problems. It is *not* waterproof, however. I'd say it's water resistant. Once it was kind of sprinkling and everything within stayed totally dry. The third trip was nearly full rain and our hard-side luggage which was expanded (the zipper part in the middle which unzips to give you additional space) got wet and some things right by that part got wet. But the bag itself did not have water in it in pools or anything. Glad we bought this--five people and a dog crowd any vehicle on a long trip and this bag definitely get some of the bulk out of the way!
customer_reviews.author: 3 Girls NC

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Leaked on the very first trip. We are a careful family and we did not overstuff it. We made sure the zipper was completely covered by the flap. Fortunately we were also careful enough not to pack things that had to stay dry up there.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Used on our rav4 which does NOT ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Used on our rav4 which does NOT have cross bars. Attached ratchet straps to the side rails to make faux cross bars (we felt it would be needed to keep the bag from sliding forward/backward). Worked perfectly! Did not budge from Buffalo NY to Hilton Head SC and back. Fit a small, medium, and large suitcase, as well as 2 beach chairs. We only encountered light rain and our things remained dry. The only negative comment; my husband is convinced that it significantly reduced our gas mileage... but that would probably be true of just about any roof bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kt

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to pack/unpack and not actually waterproof
customer_reviews.text: It's a process to get it on, filled, and strapped down since you have to fill it before you can strap it down. It would be easier if you could anchor it, then fill it. It could have separate straps to tighten down over the top. That way, you wouldn't have to disconnect the whole thing while you're loading/unloading it all the while trying not to let it slide off or shift too much. It's also not actually waterproof. We packed it and were very careful to be sure the zipper was covered by its flap, but driving through light/moderate rain still caused anything next to the zipper to get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for an 8 hour trip
customer_reviews.text: We were a little skeptical at first, but this bag worked great. Summer trip in the NW, so no rain involved, but we did take it 70mph on the top of a Ford Explorer for 8 hours. It didn't move at all. We just have siderails that we tied it to. Everything was just where we left it on the way there and on the way back. And I honestly didn't' notice much drag at all from having it on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hobart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent frame
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to be a single use case; however I was pleasantly surprised. I had this on my roof for a 3000 mile cross country journey (through a tornado warning at one point) and everything stayed dry as a bone. I strapped it down with my own ratchets just to be safe. Despite the stresses of the journey, this bag remains in excellent condition and is in my garage waiting for my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative to Hard-Shells
customer_reviews.text: Cheap alternative to a hard-shell carrier, but it does have some drawbacks. Pros: Cheap. Highly Durable. In my experience, completely weather-proof (driving freeway speeds for two hours in steady rain). Fits a ton of crap. Cons: Somewhat laborious to attach to roof correctly. Somewhat laborious to fill to capacity with crap. AND, it is best to both fill it completely with crap and attach it to the roof correctly. Any slack in the bag or straps will result in some horrible wind-induced noises coming from atop your car.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A.I.Shears

customer_reviews.title: Showed signs of deteriorating on first trip
customer_reviews.text: We have a Chrysler Town and Country, so there are only railings on two sides of the roof, not all 4. We tied everything down tightly, but the bag still started to deteriorate on our Ohio to Disney trip. Our stuff did stay dry on the way down, but the wear was clearly visible on the drive back and we are unsure if the bag will last for another trip.
customer_reviews.author: OhioUser

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: While the product in-of itself works as intended (holding contents, and quite roomy at that) the problem is that it leaks. We ordered this product for a long road trip and the straps stayed in tact, everything remained safe and in place... other than the fact that we went through a storm and everything got soaked. If you're staying in warm climate and small isolated storms it would probably be fine, we went through a fairly big storm, and while it DID remain solid, in place, and didn't budge... it leaked. We'll be upgrading to a solid storage system and ditching the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use when we travel to FL on top of our van which has roof bars and a roof rack. This works great, however it did leak some when we drove to FL last time, but it was 2 days of travel and overnight in the pouring rain. And it was only in one location in the Cargo Bag. The suitcase wasn't soaked, but items were pretty damp. Just don't put anything super valuable up there! We just put our suitcases/bags with clothes in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Allen

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, only issue is the cheap buckles on the product.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked great on our trip from Wisconsin to Washington state this last summer. We hit a terrible rain storm in Minnesota on our way out and this bad didn't leak at all. My wife and I were able to fit a lot of our camping gear that we took with us in it. The reason that I only gave this 4 stars is because one of the buckle broke the first time we used it. If they simply upgraded the buckles from cheap plastic to a metal buckle this would be the perfect product for every camping trip or trip in general.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Cabada

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I went about 1200 miles with this on the roof of my acadia. I put a pack n' play, stroller, suitcase, collapsible playpen, two giant boxes of baby diapers, and it still was barely half full. My car doesn't have crossbars so I just put each strap around the sidebars. I also bought the recommended mat to use under the bag. It didn't budge an inch despite highway speeds and strong winds. Everything was dry and clean when I emptied it. I highly recommend this if you need extra cargo space.
customer_reviews.author: Grace McTwiddles

customer_reviews.title: Crappy size and gas mileage
customer_reviews.text: Is much smaller than appears. Doesn’t hold much. Also arrived with a hole in the bottom, so I had to buy a tarp to line the bottom if any leaks occurred. DRAMATICALLY drops your gas mileage. My normal of 25-30 mph was reduced to 14-18 mph with this on top. I previously had a hard top carrier- will go back to that as didn’t effect gas mileage as much. NOT IN ANY WAY AERODYNAMIC!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: It may not be as durable and water resistant as it seems
customer_reviews.text: We traveled from Florida to Alabama. There was rain most of the way in Florida. Once we arrived to our destination. I found my clothes to be damp on the bottom of my luggage along with two other luggage’s. Our next trip was from Alabama to Georgia. Good weather . Our leg home was from Georgia back to Florida. Not even 30 minutes into the ride we heard a loud humming noise. The “Keeper”had a tear in it. We had to find duct tape at a convenient store/gas station. I was not pleased. I’m hoping our clothing did not get wet. This was our first time using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds a surprising amount of stuff in many shapes and sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on top of my Kia Soul from Naples, FL to Mpls, MN then on to Boise, ID with no leaks, tears or worn spots. All this through lots of rain, side winds and highway speeds. It is important to tie it down firmly as being fabric it could flex easily. Since it is fabric and flexible you can really load it up with lots of stuff if you pack well and tightly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rhyner

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Went on a 3500 mile trip to the west coast and had this up the entire trip. Through rain and all had zero leaks. I made sure the zipper flaps were always tucked and secure. Checked straps at every stop for gas because I'm a worry wort. Never had a strap come loose. Used no slip rubber drawer liner sheet under to protect roof. Seemed to work good. It will hold quite alot if you can pack good. I had it stuffed tight with 4 sleeping bags, four pillows, 6 person tent, 2 rolled up air mattresses, 2 tri leg chairs, odds and ends like some cooking utensils ect. With some elbow grease and good planning it can holds alot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Weather tight. Not water resistant. Instructions recommend bagging items.
customer_reviews.text: Used this on our 12 round trip vacation. No rips or tears. I cannot comment on water issues as we had maybe a little rain. I was slightly put off when I read the direction and it says that it is weather tight , but not water resistant. I think the item led me to believe that it was water tight. It reccomended that I place my items in plastic bags. Huge pain in the behind. I’d rather not have to do that. We also don’t have cross rails and it worked fine, just added an extra ratchet strap over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Good product especially for the price. Durable and easy to connect to cars that don't have a luggage rack. The only thing was that is was noisy UNTIL we realized what was making the noise. The corners were not filled with stuff and were flapping around - we shoved a towel or sweatshirt into each corner and problem fixed. Drove over 1200 miles and not a problem at all. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: EthanJ

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Just did a 3,000 mile road trip with this bag and it was awesome! Easy to put on the van and strapped down very securely. We went thru some rain at over 70 mph and the stuff inside stayed completely dry. The zipper was good quality and held strong when this thing was stuffed to the max. The only thing I will be keeping an eye on are the straps and buckled, not the highest quality but for 50 bucks I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: Tin cup

customer_reviews.title: You only had one job!!
customer_reviews.text: To keep our stuff dry! The quality seemed good enough upon initial inspection and loading this bag into the van. However, We are only halfway through a 700 mile trip and got some heavy rains through West Virginia. At the first hotel stop, our suitcases were all wet and there were actually puddles on the inside of the bag. Highway speed was not a factor because we are pulling a trailer and only averaged about 60mph. Will be returning. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamomeara

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Bought the peremium version of the roof top bag. We laid it out on our roof basket and filled it with two cabin size carry on suitcases, one large suitcase and filled the spaces in between with a few bags. This roof bag served it's purpose for our long trip, it drizzled and rained most of our 300 mile drive, with 30 minutes of pouring rain in one segment. All contents we're dry!! Pleasantly surprised. Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Sri

customer_reviews.title: 3000 mile road trip with success!
customer_reviews.text: Did what is was supposed to! It holds a lot of items when you load it properly. It helps to be a Tetris expert to maximize its content! It is weatherproof and NOT really waterproof but I had placed all my luggage in garbage bags which worked out great on a 3000 mile road trip and came across heavy rainfalls. Definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Testa

customer_reviews.title: Best for bulky but light items to preserve your handling ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this for three camping trips on top of a Hyundai Entourage minivan. Frees up a lot of space - for us it holds 3 XL sleeping pads, 2 regular and 1 large sleeping bag, six-person REI tent, two chairs, and room left to stuff a couple pillows or towels too. Best for bulky but light items to preserve your handling dynamics. No flapping if it's well stuffed, stays in place (we use a grip mat underneath) and seems durable enough. Can't comment on waterproofness (because California!) but if it's zipped and the weather flap is velcroed down I can't see it being a problem. Great value for $50.
customer_reviews.author: Irl R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Not just for roof tops
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these not as roof top carriers, but as pickup bed carriers. I have a tonneau cover on my pickup that is not water proof, so when we travel, I have been putting luggage in plastic trash bags. The Keeper works perfect in the bed of the pickup by protecting luggage and other items from getting wet The are the perfect size and easy to load, zip, and forget. If a multiple day trip, I put long-term luggage in the one closest to the cab and overnight luggage in the one closest to the tailgate. With the tonneau cover locked and the tailgate locked, the contents are relative safe....perhaps, moreso than on the roof of a car.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a big, strong, and definitely waterproof bag. We took it on a trip to Florida from Syracuse, NY and lo and behold it rained cats and dogs on the round-trip! I was very concerned because all of our bags and clothes were inside of this bag but when we go home, I was surprised to see that there wasn't one drop of water inside the bag. I definitely recommend this bag for traveling lighter inside your car and for extra storage!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Carucci

customer_reviews.title: ... was a bit skeptical about this product given the great price point
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was a bit skeptical about this product given the great price point. We did not notice any of the issues that others posted in older posts, so I assume they have resolved these things. For us, we put this on our Chrysler Town and Country and drove from California to Arizona. The product held up well, and I did not notice any stress tears, problems with the zipper, etc. I think anyone who complains about flapping noise just simply doesn't know how to use the slide adjusters correctly. We had zero flapping noises or any other problems. The zipper size was good also.
customer_reviews.author: Agent Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great/Inexpensive option
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this at the last minute for a road trip. I was skeptical about it because of the responses about it not being very durable in the rain so we wrapped our luggage in heavy duty trash bags and then placed them inside of the roof rack. Although we took the 1600 mile road trip and went through some heavy rains this roof rack stood up very well. I was very happy with this purchase. We will be purchasing a heavy duty hard case in the near future only for the aerodynamic features of it. The only con was at times we could feel/hear the wind hitting the roof rack. Otherwise it was all good!
customer_reviews.author: LaKiki

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, road worthy, frees up cabin space
customer_reviews.text: Trip from Florida to Michigan for 3 weeks and back. Over 3000 miles and still looks like new. This bag has lots of space and is very easy to secure to Hitch rack. Never saw any hint of water inside. I have the keeper car topper too but this is so much better on gas mileage and general driving comfort. You don't even know it's back there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: Using this primarily for storage to get down to scout camp and I've already noticed some of the stitching starting to pop, and seams to rip. Haven't had it in the rain yet, but the material seems waterproof enough. I did notice the front lip likes to blow up because there isn't any velcro there to secure it down, so it might leak along the front zip line.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Lackovic

customer_reviews.title: This keeper is a keeeper!
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag knowing it would be a one time use type thing, so I was extremely pleased with it’s performance. I moved from VA to NV over the last 7 days, and this thing held up through wind and POURING rain like a champ. I did read a lot of reviews saying it wasn’t totally water proof, so I made sure I only packed my vacuum sealed clothes in it. No issues. If you need a bag for this type of trip purpose, can’t beat this little guy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: but am very disappointed the bag could not sustain more than one trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought the roof bag for a road trip from Florida to Colorado Springs visiting our son stationed in Fort Carson. We arrived after 1,831 miles, the bag performed very well, withstanding speed, wind, and bugs. The return trip got us in heavy rain once back in Florida, allowing just a strap safety check at each stop. Once Home I noticed the front right corner of the bag had ripped, as well as the top right strap allowing water and bugs to enter the bag. Thankfully everything inside was well packed avoiding damage, but am very disappointed the bag could not sustain more than one trip.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Russell Simonet

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add additional cargo space for a camping trip. We received some pretty intense down pours during our travel and luckily on the way to camping the cargo bag remained water free, however, the way home we were not so lucky and the gear was soaking wet. The zipper flaps were secure so I'm not sure what we could have done differently. It was great to have the extra room but I'm disappointed that it did not perform great in rain.
customer_reviews.author: S. Baranczyk

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful buy, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag to move from Atlanta to Buffalo and I have to say I'm impressed. I did use additional ratchet straps to secure it to my roof rack and a kitchen stick grip (like you'd use in drawers or cabinets) underneath it to keep it from slipping, but it held in place for a little under 1,000 miles through pouring down rain! My stuff did get a little damp, but overall I have to say I'm very impressed. We used it again for a shorter, 100 mile trip not too long ago and it worked fantastically again. Best piece of luggage I've ever bought. Don't hesitate to buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie F

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Handy Product!
customer_reviews.text: Nice carrier! We used this on a 1500 mile (each way) road trip. I bought the set which came with the mat that goes underneath it and ratchet straps. I also used one extra ratchet strap of my own. It worked fabulous! And the best part is that it folds up and I can store it in my basement. There is a cover that completely covers the zipper to keep water out. We didn't encounter any rain, but my folks have the same Product (they told me to buy this one), and they've used it through a couple major rainstorms and snowstorms and everything stays dry. You won't be disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Queenie

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS AWESOME NO ROOF RACK NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: I drove over 2,000 miles with this through hail, rain, snow and a sand storm! I went as fast as 90mph and the only downfall is that the straps can bring in water if it rains- but after I tested it I just used ratchet straps and left the original straps out of the car. No water! Can’t believe it held up. I bought a $2 non slip mat that goes under rugs to help it grip more- but ended up forgetting to put it on anyways. Thanks for helping me bring all of my stuff back home from my trip! HOLDS A LOT
customer_reviews.author: Katelin

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier, just plan to take some time installing the first time
customer_reviews.text: This cargo carrier performed well once installed. My husband and son loaded and secured the carrier on the rack of our Ford Excursion. The only aggravation they had was tightening down the straps on our vehicle. They managed to get it done, though. We had no noise from the carrier while driving from southeastern Michigan to southwestern Kentucky. We drove through some serious downpours, but no water got in the carrier. Other than the frustration with the straps, this was a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised how well this bag worked. Used to transport tents, camping chairs, duffel bags, etc and all were kept safe and secure during our trip. The straps could use a secondary means to secure any excess length otherwise there is a chance for slapping against the roof or bag. This happened to us and was annoying and actually caused the end of the strap to fray.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Neuert

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what I needed. Seems very durable. We were able to get quite a bit packed in this. I did not have a front bar on cargo rack so I clipped the ones on the front to the sides. Seemed secure, but wish the front strapped were long for this purpose. Took a little bit to get all the straps adjusted the first time. Had a ladder when packing at home, much more difficult to pack when we were leaving without a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment and way to free car space
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I use it for going camping, it fits quite a few items, such as blankets, pillows, sleeping bags, etc. It's been three weeks since my last camping trip and I simply didn't bother to check inside. The weather has been rainy and windy at times. Checked it today before this weekend's trip - everything is dry and good to be used again! I was very pleasantly surprised. Just be sure that you seal the sides with velcro to cover the zippers, otherwise stuff might get wet. But if you use it as directed, you won't be disappointed. A great investment if you need to save space inside your car. Easy to install, too. High recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Irina Malkina

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Was amazed at how much fit inside of it including a guitar! Some things take a little common sense as the straps were not going to work for our particular vehicle. So, we got some rope and made do. Tied down going across in an X to make sure to avoid any wind flapping. Can't testify to any "bad weather" conditions as all we dealt with was cold. The trip was from SC to Colorado though and made it all in one piece with no tears or damage. Was definitely worth it to get the extra things back we needed after the inside of the vehicle was stuffed! Good purchase! :)
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Coming back to write a review. This thing rocked out drive from Colorado to Alaska. 7 days on top of my Subaru crosstrek through wind and rain and a ton of bugs! Strong and sturdy, held tight. Easy enough to get into if you needed something, but slightly time consuming because of the straps. Definitely have to twist up and tie the extra length of the straps or they make a lot of noise. Love that I'm able to fold it up to keep in the shed for easy storage. Look forward to going camping with this next year!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: This is the answer! And so affordable too!
customer_reviews.text: I was so sick of cramming our family of 5, plus luggage and supplies in our rav4, and then driving our cramped selves the 12+ hours our trips are. This thing was the answer. Made it through a snow storm in the PNW and back without a drop of our luggage getting wet. WELL worth the money and small hassle of loading everything on top of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself seems to be well made and definitely keeps the water out. The downside is the very first use one of the straps ripped completely loose during light tightening. I will be trying to return or replace this bag as that is unacceptable. There seemed to be issues with those parts all around after this one ripped off. I was more careful with the others leaving them somewhat loose but could see them pulling at the base from the tension.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked could use some modifications
customer_reviews.text: Packed it with a beach cart, 4 beach towels, 3 boogie boards, beach umbrella and 2 duffle bags the zipper was tight but it survived from NJ to OBX and back with heavy rain on the way there no water got inside. I wish they made the bottom out of a rigid material like a pack and play bottom we bought a large card board box from the depot and layed it out on the inside bottom packed it tight on the floor then me and my son lifted it on to the roof rack and strapped it down worked good next time will use 1/4 plywood for inside bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: Roof Top Cargo Bag is MUCH Less Expensive than a Cargo Box.
customer_reviews.text: This Waterproof Roof Top Cargo Bag is made of rubber coated nylon and is very strong, yet flexible -- even if you don't need to use the entire 15 cubic feet of space provided. It includes 2 tie-down straps per each of 4 sides, and can be used with or without a roof top basket. Since it is made of waterproofed nylon, it folds down easily to a small size (similar to a shoe box). I chose this product because the roof top basket and waterproofed carrier bag is a LOT less expensive than the carrier boxes made by Thule and others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage, it does not keep the contents dry. I have used it on just two long trips, on both trips the contents got wet during steady rain. If you foolishly buy this inferior product I strongly suggest you wrap your gear in plastic bags. And yes I loaded and correctly closed the keeper, I watched the video multiple times prior to using. While there is a lip that closes over the zipper seam it is sealed with a limited number of velcro patches, I think rain is getting blown in along the zipper seam but I am not 100 percent sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W. Tuthill

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, but not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy bag we purchased to carry a double stroller (see photos) on the roof of our car. Made an 8 hour drive at 70mph and it didn't budge. I did find some water droplets in it on the trip back where it rained most of the journey. This was despite making sure the zipper was NOT facing forward and the flaps were all secured with the velcro over the exposed zipper. This bag actually set on the paint and didn't cause any damage to it, but I think I may seek out a universal basket in the future to make sure it doesn't cause any damage.
customer_reviews.author: BootlegBrewer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, just hard to tighten to bars, to prevent it from sliding around.
customer_reviews.text: I used this when it was snowing (and raining) in the end of Dec, driving from Cali to Nebraska. 1.) Kept everything dry. 2.) Was hard to buckle and secure it so it wouldn't move around. 3.) Its not secure. So you want to either stuff it back in the vehicle at night (if youre staying at a hotel which we did) or drag it in the hotel room. 4.) Make sure its stuffed; the wind noise is real. ONLY complaint is that it was hard to tighten it to secure it to the bars.
customer_reviews.author: Cher Bear

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Did an amazing job! I bought this yo travel from San Diego to Kentucky and it held all the kids bags and the extras that were acquired from grandparents. Easy to assemble and and just as easy to tie down on the roof of a Dodge Journey. No issues during travel and there definitely rain and everything stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for camping. We traveled about 3 hours each way. We were able to fit our 12 person tent, queen size cot and air mattress, pack and play, 4 camping chairs, and 2 boxes with kid bubble lawn mowers. We don't have the front racks so the front straps went on the sides. The bag did not move. We went through a little rain and everything was dry. No complaints. Very happy we chose this one instead of spending 4x the price on a hard shell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a bundle when I bought side rails and crossbars for my wife's minivan. We have used it on several trips in all kinds of weather and we have never experienced any issues with the bag. We even rode through a very strong storm that lasted for several hours and the bag stayed watertight with all of our belongings perfectly dry. Setup is pretty easy, the only hard part is putting all your stuff on the roof specially in a Minivan or SUV. If your vehicle does not have some sort of protection in the roof I would suggest looking into a protective mat in order to avoid scratching the finish of your car.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof but
customer_reviews.text: I researched many similar car toppers and their was not one that someone didn't get wet inside. Drove from FL to MA and it rained big time for half the trip. I was very careful to put things in garbage bags so no problem when I opened it and found a small amount of water inside. The directions even tell you to do this. Need crossbars! Prepare for the worst and hope for the best. None of these toppers should be advertised as waterproof, but. The good, big, great hold down system, strong zipper, tough fabric and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money on the big brand plastic models
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I couldn't afford Thule. I took precautions to keep the contents dry, but no water got in. I don't worry about mileage because if you're taking a trip where you need this much stuff, and you have a vehicle that can carry the load, mileage is obviously not your top priority.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% waterproof, but highly water resistant.
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from me 3000 mi round trip with the bag on top doing 75 miles an hour for most of the way. Bag held up great. Heavy rain for the first 3 hours and very little water inside around zipper seams. Not one hundred percent waterproof but definitely highly water resistant. I put everything that I didn't mind getting wet on top just to check out and make sure it was okay. If you're wanting to put luggage in it I would wrap it in heavy garbage bags first.
customer_reviews.author: patrick norton

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this for our beach trip and I'm so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our beach trip and I'm so glad I did. We have a 2008 Ford Escape and I didn't think we'd be able to fit everything we needed in the car. It was easy to strap on and held 3 Tommy Bahama Beach Chairs, 2 baby gates, a beach tent (folded up of course), some towels, and a few other items. I can't say much about the water proof feature, because I don't think it rained at all on our drive, but since the reviews seemed iffy, I didn't put anything in the cargo bag that I wouldn't want to get wet. It was definitely worth the purchase. We also got the protective mat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in rain and wind
customer_reviews.text: We packed this up and drove over 1,800 miles with this on top of our van and no problems. Held up in rain also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a couple times and, so far, it has been great. Particularly given the very reasonable price, this is one of those products that I wish I had invested in sooner. One of the times I used it there was a very heavy rain. I made sure the seams were pulled down over the zippers and did not have any issues with water leaking in. I will still probably pack items in plastic bags that I wouldn't otherwise want to get wet, but that's just as an extra precaution.
customer_reviews.author: Traxbe

customer_reviews.title: Happy traveler
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy on our Christmas trip to DC. Definitely a space saver and held up nicely through different climates and precipitation. Did notice the wind noise but expected some of it in advance. Only con was the strap tension buckles. I found it difficult at times to tighten or loosen the straps and was worried the plastic buckle connectors would break somewhere along our journey. Pleased to report that the connectors held up nicely! All in all a good product and it holds more that I would have thought. Just make sure the flaps are down during any rain encounters because if they're not the water will soak through the cloth zipper housing!
customer_reviews.author: debra phillips

customer_reviews.title: Leaks! Will be returning.
customer_reviews.text: Leaks! We should of test drove before our trip to Miami. We were headed on a cruise and had no way to purchase additional clothing. Very frustrating after reading the positive reviews. Lesson learned; test your purchase before heading out of town!
customer_reviews.author: CBC

customer_reviews.title: Great cargo carrier
customer_reviews.text: Great cargo carrier, used it for a weekend trip to snow country. Lots of rain inside stayed dry, also light wet snow. Strapped to the roof fine no noise once I removed the roof pad. Easy to install, felt secure I checked as per directions, after 10 miles than again after 50 mi. I filled the Keeper to capacity, included a large fold-up kennel (all metal). I really liked this Keeper cargo bag. Only used it for one trip, but no visible signs of damage or stress on the clips.
customer_reviews.author: jlook

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought it years ago. Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a 1000 mile trip to Florida. Put one ridiculously large suitcase, one regular suitcase and 3 “carry on” sized suitcases for the kids in the bag and a few other items. Worked great. It never rained so I don’t know about it keeping things dry. Held up great, cannot even tell it was used except for some bug splatter. The 8 straps kept everything secure and gave me piece of mind. I practice packed with the suitcases we were using while they were empty on the living room floor. Trying to figure it out on top of the Highlander would not have been fun.
customer_reviews.author: mark epps

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beach trip!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to add some more space to our vehicle for a vacation. Our vehicle had top rails/luggage rack installed and this can strap to those very easily. It does take some muscle to tighten it down but this holds a surprisingly large amount of items. All my items for a 7 day vacation went in here and only took up 1/3 of the space. Went through rain with no leaks. Great product for this situation.
customer_reviews.author: R.Brad Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!! Unfortunately, it would not let me submit this review with zero stars. This rooftop cargo carrier is NOT waterproof. We were traveling down the PNW to San Francisco and pulled my suit case down and realised that it was wet. All my clothes on the bottom were wet. I also had a couple pillows in the cargo carrier and one was COMPLETELY soaked and ended up throwing it away. Save yourself the trouble and just find something better!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my RAV4
customer_reviews.text: A little too big for my roof rack in my Rav4 but was able to pack less in it and stuff the extra material underneath the roof rack for it to work. Worked great on a cross-country road trip from CO to GA and would recommend packing as full as you can so it won't move even if some items are light like pillows. It rained my whole journey and the bags inside were wet as I had expected. Recommend packing everything in something waterproof or you will have to air dry your clothes like I did after the journey.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! A definite recommend. Durable and Waterproof👍🏾
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I loved this product. Drove in my Volvo XC90 from Columbia SC to Tacoma Washington(2900+ mi) and more than half my trip was in the rain. Got to my destination and not only was everything dry but it was still secure in place on the roof of my car. I recommend this product to anyone needing a little extra cargo space. I packed an XL suitcase, XL military Ruck Sac, King Size blanket and an XL Ziploc bag of clothes. I tied the Keeper down with extra cargo straps also. Had a little sound from wind but even at 80mph it didn't move. Go buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: Gemmy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and stood the test of a long drive.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag! We had a bag for a few years and it ripped on our way home from vacation. We replaced it with this one this year. Took her on a maiden voyage for about 14 hours each way, through the rain and traveling about 75mph. It held up great. We packed it pretty full and had no problem zipping it up. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

product_meta.title: Keeper 07203-1 Waterproof Roof Top Cargo Bag (15 Cubic Feet)
product_meta.description: Size:15 Cubic FeetWaterproof rooftop cargo bag with 15 cubic feet of space Increases vehicle cargo space Waterproof design protects cargo against road grit, sun, wind and rain Soft sides flex to fit odd-shaped loads Folds compact for easy storage
feature_bullets: Waterproof rooftop cargo bag with 15 cubic feet of space ; Fits all roof racks
Increases vehicle cargo space. Designed to fit all roof racks with attachment capabilities on all four sides, if less than four, caution needs to be taken for secure attachment.
Waterproof design protects cargo against road grit, sun, wind and rain.
Soft sides flex to fit odd-shaped loads. Heavy duty construction
Folds compact for easy storage. Overall size is 44” x 34” x 17”.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,559 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
